item.title: Police release first picture of Gus as ADF joins the search for missing child
item.description: Police have released the first image of Gus since his disappearance, with almost 50 members of the Australian Defence Force joining the search for the four-year-old in mid-north South Australia.

item.title: 'Tomorrow could be the day': Jordan Brunoli from Bugs opens up about terminal cancer fears
item.description: At 29, Australian musician Jordan Brunoli was diagnosed with incurable cancer. He says he's terrified of what comes next.

item.description: A 32-year-old serving a prison sentence for serious assault has been located after going missing in north-west Queensland.

item.description: Documents sought through freedom of information laws show the extent of fish contamination in a NSW river, information an inquiry found the EPA kept from the community for eight months.

item.description: The Canterbury Bulldogs boss assures fans he is on the mend after being hospitalised when doctors found a problem during routine blood tests.

item.description: Mary Fowler praises Manchester City for its support as the Matildas star announces a contract extension.

item.description: This year, Helen Garner has been in Dua Lipa's book club and the SATC spin-off. Now she's in the running for the Baillie Gifford Prize for non-fiction.

item.title: Jane Goodall, who revolutionised our understanding of animals, dies at 91

item.title: Date set for Townsville mayoral by-election by postal ballot
item.description: Townsville voters who have been in limbo since their mayor was suspended last year will vote in a by-election to select the city's next civic leader.

item.title: Review of west coast bushfires finds flaws in Tasmania's firefighting responses
item.description: A COVID outbreak that "spread quickly" through a cramped fire management headquarters was just one issue faced during the response to Tasmania's west coast fires last summer, a review finds.

item.title: Dartbrook Hunter Valley mine to stop running after failed revival
item.description: The struggling Dartbrook Coal Mine will stop running less than a year after its new operators tried to revive it.

item.description: The Reserve Bank warns risks to the global financial system are "rising", not receding, and Australia is not immune from any fallout.

item.description: Brown foam has blanketed one of the state's most popular tourist beaches in South Australia, as the state government launches an algal bloom hotline.

item.description: The new visa is designed to attract top global STEM talent but has sparked fierce backlash, with critics warning it could squeeze Chinese nationals out of the graduate job market.

item.description: The death of Chris Robertson, whose body was found at an industrial site in Adelaide's south on Tuesday, is now being treated as a major crime, police say.

item.description: Australian travellers heading to the United States are being warned to expect disruptions with some tourist attractions closed, flights disrupted and national parks and museums affected.

item.description: Detectives have a possible identity for a body in a burnt-out station wagon in north-west New South Wales and have appealed for more information.

item.description: Australian-based players headline the Afghan women's refugee football team preparing to play for the first time since the Taliban takeover in 2021, but they're still pushing for greater autonomy over their future.

item.description: Jarred Drew Heath told police he wished he had a bullet and an "AK" to shoot officers with.

item.title: Menindee fish passage trial aimed at preventing mass deaths enters second stage
item.description: A fish passage that connects the Darling River with Lake Wetherell in order to redistribute native fish is being trialled with the aim of preventing more ecological disasters.

item.description: With Australia's men's Test team largely settled, there are a few key spots that could hang on a handful of Sheffield Shield performances before the start of the Ashes.

item.title: Indonesia boarding school collapse reflects a 'widespread' building problem
item.description: An operation to rescue around 60 children trapped under an Islamic boarding school in Indonesia's East Java province has now shifted into a recovery operation, with the death toll expected to significantly rise.

item.title: Organisers refuse offer to move Agnes Water festival off rainbow bee-eater bird nesting site
item.description: A two-day cultural festival will go ahead this weekend on top of a protected bird's nesting site in Queensland after organisers declined an offer of help to relocate it.

item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and opposition energy spokesperson Dan Tehan have both arrived home from trips abroad with a spring in their step.

item.title: Australia's Kaylen Bassett wins bronze at ICF Slalom World Championships
item.description: Australia's Kaylen Bassett manages Australia's first podium finish at the ICF Slalom World Championships in Penrith, while Olympic gold medallist Noémie Fox is left to reflect on what might have been.

item.description: A retired detective is urging the man who once confessed to Cheryl Grimmer's murder to hand himself in, as volunteers search for her remains in Wollongong.

item.description: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO's net worth hit $US500 billion ($755 billion) on Wednesday, the "Real-Time Billionaires" tracker reported.

item.title: Man charged with lighting fires after start of fire bans in Queensland
item.description: A 27-year-old man has been charged with deliberately setting fire to bushland in Blackswamp, south-west Queensland, during a total fire ban.

item.description: The fire threatened communities, destroyed more than 3,500km of fencing and cost the NT's cattle industry an estimated $120 million.

item.description: Fertility treatments in NSW will be able to continue even in cases where the family donor limit has been breached after the state government issued a temporary exemption.

item.description: Authorities say getting to close to numbats can make them anxious enough to abandon their young and are urging photographers to give the endangered animals their space.

item.description: On Wednesday, Donald Trump proclaimed his Middle East peace deal an "amazing thing". By week's end, things were not as straightforward as they seemed.

item.title: Don't let derangement syndrome throw shade on Anthony Albanese's global wins as steady approach pays off
item.description: This week feels like it's time to officially add Albanese Derangement Syndrome to the diagnostic and statistical manual of political disorders.

item.title: One in five girls consider dropping athletics and swimming due to periods, new research shows
item.description: Research by Federation University has found 63 per cent of girls have missed training, and a third have missed competitions, because of period-related challenges in athletics and swimming.

item.title: Pete Hegseth announces latest strike on boat near Venezuela he says was trafficking drugs
item.description: Without providing evidence, Pete Hegseth says the intelligence "without a doubt" confirms that the vessel was carrying drugs and that the people on board were "narco-terrorists".

item.title: Supreme Court ruling over community housing council rates may trigger hike for NT home owners
item.description: The NT Supreme Court is set to hand down a ruling on whether a major community housing provider is exempt from paying council rates in Palmerston. It's a case which may set a territory-wide precedent, reshape council budgets and force them to slash services or hike rates.

item.title: Former health boss says a new hospital won't fix WA's health crisis amid record ambulance ramping
item.description: The man tasked with reviewing WA's "old and depleted" hospitals says building a brand new one will not fix a snowballing health crisis.

item.title: Hamas prepared to release all Israeli hostages under Trump's Gaza plan — as it happened
item.description: The US president says "this is a very special day" and thanks other countries for their assistance in the peace proposal.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to 50 months' prison after offering tearful apologies in court
item.description: A New York judge says the disgraced music mogul's violence, coercion and abuse had devastating consequences on his two former partners, and he was unconvinced that Combs would not reoffend.

item.title: Why the similarities and differences between Cameron Munster and Reece Walsh will decide the 2025 grand final
item.description: Not many players can be like Cameron Munster and Reece Walsh except for one another, and that's why they hold the fate of the 2025 NRL grand final in their hands.

item.title: Ratepayers struggle with cost of living as Qld councils increase rates to alleviate financial pressures
item.description: Advocates say an outdated funding model and cost shifting has left Queensland councils in a risky financial position, with nowhere left to turn for cash except ratepayers.

item.title: Oscar Piastri bounces back from Baku GP disaster with sizzling practice run in Singapore
item.description: Australian Oscar Piastri quickly bounces back from his Baku nightmare to set the fastest time on the first day of practice at the Singapore Grand Prix.

item.title: What the NSW pill testing trial means for this summer festival season
item.description: The service sits delicately at the intersection of harm reduction strategies by NSW Health and the police's work to stop illegal drug supply.

item.title: Dave Franco film Together pulled from China over AI censorship of queer couple
item.description: A film starring Dave Franco and Alison Brie, Together, is pulled from China after AI censorship of a queer couple in early screenings.

item.title: HUMANS space project records our thoughts on life, love and the universe
item.description: A new project is collecting thousands of messages destined for the cosmos, coinciding with the anniversary of a landmark space mission 50 years ago.

item.title: Woman with disability twice denied permission to fly with assistance dog by Air New Zealand
item.description: Brisbane woman Lisa Robinson made a discrimination complaint following the incident, and the airline has implemented changes to its policy following a two-year review.

item.title: Carlton's style shift has Blues knocking on door of AFLW top four
item.description: Carlton's emergence as a finals threat is no surprise, with the Blues now possessing the personnel to execute an effective game plan.

item.title: Fatal stabbings of boys in Melbourne's west allegedly linked to youth gang rivalry, court hears
item.description: A court case into the alleged murder of an 18-year-old last year reveals a connection to the fatal attacks on Chol Achiek, 12, and Dau Akueng, 15, on September 6.

item.title: Deputy leader confident nuclear will be part of Coalition's energy policy
item.description: As the federal Coalition looks to resurrect a nuclear policy, an energy analyst and a workers' union fear the impacts of parliament's inability to agree on Australia's energy future.

item.title: Olivia Dean, Nine Inch Nails, Big Thief lead September's best new albums
item.description: While Taylor Swift's new album might be dominating the conversation, some of the best records of the year also arrived in September, from Olivia Dean to Nine Inch Nails.

item.title: The purpose of men-only clubs like Melbourne's Savage Club seems almost neurotic
item.description: These clubs, which still exist right around the country, are the weirdest anomaly. They sit jostled up against the Australia they firmly shut their doors against; their purpose in modern Australia seems almost neurotic.

item.title: Seasonal workers' accommodation 'overcrowded' and plagued by mice, says new report
item.description: A new housing report describes accommodation provided for some seasonal workers in Australia as dangerous, overpriced and overcrowded.

item.title: The complicated messaging surrounding SA’s algal bloom summer
item.description: The face of South Australia's algal bloom response says the natural event "is not going to ruin summer" and he is looking forward to spending more time with his kids at the beach.

item.title: After a week of searching, police have found no signs of missing 4yo in South Australia's outback
item.description: A week of large-scale land and air searches have found no clues leading to the whereabouts of four-year-old Gus in outback South Australia.

item.description: The backyards of ordinary Tasmanians are becoming urban climate refuges for a "biobank" of alpine plants threatened by climate change and bushfire.

item.title: Queanbeyan's two female rugby league teams both fold mid-season due to player shortage
item.description: Female participation in rugby league across the Canberra region has reached a record high. Despite this, both women's teams in Queanbeyan have been forced to fold mid-season due to a player shortage.

item.description: Matildas skipper Sam Kerr plays just 17 minutes off the bench for Chelsea as they lose their perfect WSL record with a 1-1 draw at Manchester United.

item.description: Israeli troops are moving closer and closer to the heart of Gaza City, razing rows of buildings and converting tent cities into front lines, an ABC News analysis of satellite images shows.

item.description: The move is the latest financial offer made by the Department of Homeland Security, aimed at encouraging voluntary deportations.

item.description: The helicopter that crashed near Bankstown Airport, killing the instructor and hospitalising the teenage student-pilot, was owned by well-known operator Bankstown Helicopters.

item.title: Olympic champion Noémie Fox knocked out in kayak cross medal chase at ICF Slalom World Championships
item.description: Olympic gold medallist Noémie Fox falls short in her bid to deliver a kayak cross victory in front of home fans after a disappointing run at the ICF Slalom World Championships.

item.description: The Kangaroos' premiership defence remains on course following a 68-point thrashing of Sydney, while Brisbane snags its third consecutive win of the season.

item.description: Campers on Moreton Island, off the coast of south-east Queensland, have been evacuated and nearby residents told to prepare to leave as a large, out-of-control bushfire burns in the island's north.

item.title: Hundreds attend justice march for Kaiden Morgan-Johnston in Morwell
item.description: Around 600 people attend a justice march for Kaiden Morgan-Johnston, who died after he was allegedly stabbed while walking to a friend's house in Morwell.

item.description: Inclement weather in Colombo leaves Sri Lanka and Australia waiting for the start of their Women's Cricket World Cup pool match.

item.title: Russian strike hits Ukrainian passenger train at Shostka station, authorities say
item.description: A Russian drone strike has hit a passenger train in Ukraine's northern Sumy region and injured dozens of people in an act President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has denounced as 'terrorism'.
